sols:
Given a vector $\vec{x}$, the 1-norm of that vector
is\[\left\| \vec{x} \right \| _{1} = \left | x _{1} \right| + \left | x _{2} \right| + \left | x _{3} \right | + . . . . . . + \left | x _{n} \right|\]

Given a vector $\vec{x}$, the 2-norm of that vector
is\[\left\| \vec{x} \right \| _{2} = \sqrt{\left ( \left | x _{1} \right| ^{2} + \left | x _{2} \right| ^{2} + \left | x _{3} \right| ^{2} + . . . . . . + \left | x _{n} \right| ^{2} \right )}\]

The 1-norm of
$\vec{a}$\[\left\| \vec{a} \right \| _{1} = \left | 2 \right| + \left | -3 \right| + \left | 1 \right|= 2 + 3 + 1 = 6\]

$\left\| \vec{a} \right \| _{1} = 6$

The 2-norm of
$\vec{a}$\[\left\| \vec{a} \right \| _{2} = \sqrt{\left ( \left | 2 \right| ^{2} + \left | -3 \right| ^{2} + \left | 1 \right| ^{2} \right )} = \sqrt{4 + 9 + 1} = \sqrt{14}\]

$\left\| \vec{a} \right \| _{2} = \sqrt{14}$

The 1-norm of
$\vec{b}$\[\left\| \vec{b} \right \| _{1} = \left | 2+3i \right| + \left | 2-3i \right|\]
NOTE: The magnitude of a complex number
$\left|x + yi\right | = \sqrt{(x)^{2}+(y)^{2}}$
$\left| 2+3i \right| = \sqrt{(2)^{2}+(3)^{2}}$
$\left| 2-3i \right| = \sqrt{(2)^{2}+(-3)^{2}}$ therefore,
$\left\| \vec{b} \right \| _{1} = \sqrt { (2)^{2} + (3)^{2} } + \sqrt { (2)^{2} + (-3)^{2} }$
$= \sqrt { 4 + 9 } + \sqrt { 4 + 9 } = \sqrt { 13 } + \sqrt { 13 } = 2\sqrt { 13 }$

$\left\| \vec{b} \right \| _{1} = 2\sqrt { 13 }$

The 2-norm of
$\vec{b}$\[\left\| \vec{b} \right \| _{2} = \sqrt{\left ( \left | 2+3i \right| ^{2} + \left | 2-3i \right| ^{2} \right )}\]
$= \sqrt{ \left ( \sqrt{13} \right) ^{2} + \left ( \sqrt{13} \right ) ^{2} } = \sqrt{ 13 + 13} = \sqrt{26}$

$\left\| \vec{b} \right \| _{2} = \sqrt{26}$

FINAL ANSWERS
$\left\| \vec{a} \right \| _{1} = 6 \left\| \vec{a} \right \| _{2} = \sqrt{14} \left\| \vec{b} \right \| _{1} = 2\sqrt { 13 } \left\| \vec{b} \right \| _{2} = \sqrt{26}$
